entries.title: Perl 5.14.2 is now available
entries.text: The third stable release of Perl 5.14 series.

entries.title: CPAN Testers Server Update
entries.text: Barbie (real name) has been writing about the hardware failure the CPAN Testesers server encountered and how he is dealing with it. For several weeks it was mostly hard work but now finally we start to see real results showing up along with some analysis on how he handled some performance issues.

entries.title: How to Learn Perl
entries.text: chromatic provides a simple narrative on how you can start learning Perl, which books, web sites and other resources can help.

entries.title: Always TDD, Except When You Shouldn't
entries.text: chromatic points to a very controversial article by

entries.title: CPAN modules for spelling out numbers in English
entries.text: How do you say 117? Is that 'one hundred and seventeen' or is that 'one hundred seventeen'? This is another great in-depth comparision article by Neil Bowers. This time he checked 4 modules on CPAN for the time when you'd like to use letters instead of numbers. It is limited to English. I wonder if there are similar modules in other languages as well?

entries.title: Exit statuses and how $? works
entries.text: Killing zombies and signaling orphans to exit the system? It is quite confusing for most of us who are not Unix system administrators by birth. mauke helps clearing the confusion explaining how processes in Linux terminate and how, you as a Perl programmer can deal with that.
